events.description: The release of the January 2026 PMI data for the German construction sector, showing a return to contraction.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Germany Construction PMI fell to 44.7 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Germany Construction PMI fell to 44.7 in January 2026 from 50.3 in December

facts.fact_text: Employment in the German construction sector rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: employment rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation reached a four-month high in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Input cost inflation reached a four-month high

claims.claim_text: Business expectations turned positive for the first time since May 2025, marking the highest confidence since February 2020.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: business expectations turned positive for the first time since May 2025, marking the highest confidence since February 2020

claims.claim_text: The decline in construction activity was driven by accelerated downturns in housing and commercial construction.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: The decline was driven by accelerated downturns in housing and commercial construction

evidence.evidence_text: signaling a return to contraction after the first expansion in almost four years
Input cost inflation reached a four-month high, alongside higher subcontractor charges.
employment rose for the third consecutive month at the fastest pace since March 2022
New orders fell further, reflecting weak demand from housing, commercial projects, and local government.
